My research focuses on pattern recognition and forensic statistics, with an emphasis on firearm and toolmark evidence. 
I am particularly interested in developing statistically-sound and accessible algorithms to objectively compare forensic evidence.

## Journal Articles

- **Zemmels, J.**, VanderPlas, S., Hofmann, H. *Automatic Matching of Cartridge Case Impressions*, (in preparation, to be submitted to The Journal of Data Science, Statistics, and Visualizations). 

- **Zemmels, J.**, VanderPlas, S., Hofmann, H. *Diagnostic Tools for Cartridge Case Comparison Algorithms*, (in preparation, to be submitted to The Journal of Computational and Graphical Statistics). 

- **Zemmels, J.**, VanderPlas, S., & Hofmann, H. (2023). *A Study in Reproducibility: The Congruent Matching Cells Algorithm and cmcR Package*. In The R Journal (Vol. 14, Issue 4, pp. 79â€“102). The R Foundation. https://doi.org/10.32614/rj-2023-014

## Software

### CRAN Packages

- [`cmcR`](https://github.com/CSAFE-ISU/cmcR): An Implementation of the 'Congruent Matching Cells' Method

### GitHub Packages

- [`impressions`](https://github.com/jzemmels/impressions): An R package for diagnosing cartridge case impression comparison algorithms

- [`scored`](https://github.com/jzemmels/scored): An R package to compare cartridge cases and compute similarity scores based on their breech face impressions.

### Interactive Applications

- [`cartridgeInvestigatR`](https://csafe.shinyapps.io/cartridgeInvestigatR/): process and compare cartridge case scans
